item.title: ChatGPT the New Twitter?
item.description:
Since 2022, we’ve been accustomed to text-based Q&As and black-box answers. While the use cases are numerous, I think the next wave will be dominated by image and video generation, if not already, similar to TikTok and YouTube Shorts.

ChatGPT could end up like Twitter/X: a place for the most insightful questions and answers, but with distribution largely controlled by players such as Google and MidJourney, where most users create and consume AI slop. I’ve been long on Google for a while and remain bullish on midwit AI usecases.

item.title: Dabbling with AI
item.description: A friend and I have started building AI products on the weekends to get used to the latest AI tools and their capabilities. Even though we’re just a few weeks into this (while also managing our day jobs), I’m really impressed by how advanced these tools are. Back in 2019, I dreamed of building products on my own, without relying on developers. Thanks to ser Musk and Altman, that dream is now a reality. I no longer need developers or even designers to launch the first version.

item.title: Perplexity Initial Thoughts
item.description:
I recently tried out the Perplexity app and was quite impressed with the results. While I’ve not spent enough time to come to a conclusion yet, what really delighted me was the time it took to answer my question. Searching through Perplextiy felt like speaking to a friend who knows what exactly you are looking for and spoon feeding the response.

I searched for how should I select an uploaded image on Notability inside Perplexity search. Without clicking a single link, Perplexity walked me through the image selection process whereas Google showed an answer to a different question altogether. Perplexity not only understood this simple question correctly, it shared a step by step process to resolve my query instead of an incorrect response as a summary. See screenshots below.
